intro: Ouratea plumieri, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a glossy appearance. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
